description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7iqkb","text":"Phase condensation of biomolecular particles is increasingly examined for its relevance in physiological contexts. When we observed formation of NEMO puncta associated with the outer mitochondrial membrane of damaged mitochondria, we wondered whether these puncta were incorporated into phase separated particles. Three standards of the field for determining phase separation are: (A) particles undergo fission and fusion like droplets of water, (B) individual puncta recover fluorescence after photobleaching, and (C) particles dissipate upon exposure to the organic compound 1,6-Hexanediol. Our system wherein NEMO puncta appeared to be attached to fragmented mitochondria precluded a systematic assessment of standard A. I.e., one NEMO punctum would so rarely encounter another, nor would it be prompted to split, that we could not confirm or rule out the potential for fission and fusion of droplets. This protocol describes our approach to investigating standards B and C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Live imaging to investigate mitophagy kinetics and NEMO recruitment in HeLa-M cells

funders.grant_id: Mechanisms of mitochondrial damage control by PINK1 and Parkin (ASAP-000350)

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"fc65p","text":"This protocol was developed with the HeLa subtype, HeLa-M. HeLa-M cells are flatter than standard HeLa cells, making them easier to image. They also uptake siRNA better than standard HeLa. Regardless, the protocol would be easily adaptable to standard HeLa cells or other cell culture lines. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fisk3","text":"This protocol was created in order to investigate Parkin-dependent mitophagy. Parkin and several other fluorescently-tagged mitophagy components are intended for use in the protocol.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Tissue culture,Mitophagy,Fluorescent ligands,Confocal microscopy,Live cell imaging,ASAPCRN

{"blocks":[{"key":"92ke3","text":" Using 100X objective and GFP or RFP epifluorescence, find the focal plane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e618u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5lsm7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lmv2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3gus5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"73hjk","text":"100X is necessary to achieve the desired resolution for these applications. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f9bnn","text":"Note the health of cells, transfection efficiency of the constructs, and brightness of fluorescence. If you will image multiple samples with varying conditions, you may want to observe all dishes before confirming the imaging parameters so that no images are overexposed or too dim.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b398q","text":"Configure 488, 561, and 647 lasers and accompanying exposure times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22i4o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eq1gs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7qif1","text":"Set parameters as low as possible while still detecting the signals in order to avoid phototoxicity and bleaching. For a benchmark, we use \u003c10% power and \u003c200 ms exposure for each channel. Save settings in order to maintain consistency among experiments.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

cases.title: FRAP assay
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"djcjc","text":"Cells expressing Parkin (no tag), Mito-sBFP2, EGFP-NEMO, and mCherry-p62 are treated with AntA/OligA for at least 45 min to induce mitophagy and NEMO puncta recruitment. Photobleaching is accomplished with the use of a high-powered laser. This assay should be carried out between 50 min and 1 hr 20 min post-AntA/OligA addition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: 1,6-Hexanediol assay
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fsgo6","text":"Cells expressing Parkin (no tag), EGFP-NEMO, and Mito-sBFP2 are treated with AntA/OligA to induce mitophagy. After locating cells with NEMO puncta with a confocal microscope and commencing timelapse imaging, cells are exposed to 5% 1,6-Hexanediol. This assay should be carried out between 50 min and 1 hr 20 min post-AntA/OligA addition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5auc","text":"Choose a field of view with cell(s) that look healthy and express all three fluorescent constructs, and exhibit visible NEMO/p62 puncta recruitment to mitochondria. Set focus on a confocal section approximately between 5 and 7, where 0 is the bottom, attached part of the cell and 10 is the top of the cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eaeba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9t2lv","text":"Choose several puncta to photobleach and draw box-shaped ROIs targeting them. Choose NEMO-only and NEMO-p62 puncta. Save the ROI set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9opd5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afv40","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Replace Standard Media with Imaging Media and Induce Mitophagy
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c9v2k","text":"  prior to imaging, add the   working solution of AntA/OligA to the dish making a total of   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":91,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5n6ip","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q1an","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"918ef","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":2700,"guid":"5679A190008B11EEB17CC310454D1447","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":".25","error":false,"guid":"6DCD76A0008B11EEB17CC310454D1447","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"7B3FB190008B11EEB17CC310454D1447","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bd225","text":"Samples should equilibrate to imaging media and microscope chamber for at least 10 min prior to imaging. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3parc","text":"Set FRAP and timelapse imaging parameters and engage auto-focus to maintain Z plane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a84nh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aa2ko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"833nb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u69f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bo191","text":"For FRAP, I used 18 ms/pixel, 1 cycle of photobleaching. For timelapse, I set acquisition to 1 frame/5 sec. Program acquired 5 frames before commencing photobleach, then acquisition continued for a total of 10 min.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c665c","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3parc","text":"Set timelapse imaging parameters to acquire frames every 5 sec and engage auto-focus to maintain Z plane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a84nh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa2ko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5auc","text":"Choose a field of view with cell(s) that look healthy and express both fluorescent constructs, and exhibit visible NEMO puncta recruitment to mitochondria. Set focus on a confocal section approximately between 5 and 7, where 0 is the bottom, attached part of the cell and 10 is the top of the cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eaeba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31mia","text":"Begin image acquisition and wait   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ehkp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"441F5180009E11EEB5B19FE6577A8299","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhep0","text":"Gently add   10% 1,6-Hexanediol dropwise during image acquisition and allow acquisition to continue for   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6srur","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4luj4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27qvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r7sj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"02764710009F11EEB5B19FE6577A8299","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"50D28CC0009F11EEB5B19FE6577A8299","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6cgs2","text":"This will result in a final concentration of 5%. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cp4s9","text":"End image acquisition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7f83","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4r53f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"blj0m","text":"Hexanediol administration is toxic to cells. Processes that occur later than 1 min after addition are likely artifacts of cell distress. Some protocols call for a wash-out step to reconstitute dissipated puncta; we were unable to accomplish this in a 35-mm imaging dish quickly and gently enough to avoid disturbing the focal region. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5neko","text":"Load timelapse image and saved ROI set to ImageJ. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dletu","text":"Commence imaging. Repeat FRAP assay as many times as possible within the 30 min span. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctmnn","text":"Draw a new ROI to encompass a  background area that exhibits no puncta for the whole video. Save to the ROI manager. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1b2m7","text":"Measure average fluorescence for NEMO channel and p62 channel for each ROI (including background) for every timepoint. Paste fluorescence values to a new spreadsheet in Excel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1vpm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dgh1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ql42","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"724gt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7k8el","text":"Exclude data from puncta that do not stay in the z frame. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a572j","text":"Note whether the puncta is positive for only EGFP-NEMO, or EGFP-NEMO and mCherry-p62. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lrr7","text":"Subtract the respective background value from each puncta ROI measurement for each timepoint to calculate \"Sub-bg\", i.e. NEMO puncta value at t1 minus NEMO background value at t1 equal Sub-bg. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":143,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":177,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37mpo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6j8f9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"28le4","text":"This step accounts for whole-cell bleaching effects. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"930mm","text":"Identify the minimum intensity value for each channel for each puncta, then subtract the minimum from Sub-bg's to calculate \"Sub-min\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d7nr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"67b0l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bvu3m","text":"At least one timepoint will be recorded as 0.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68r7v","text":" Identify the maximum intensity Sub-min values for each channel for each puncta, then divide each Sub-min value by the maximum to calculate \"Norm-to-max\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bj73","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e40sq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7qr3g","text":"At least one timepoint will be recorded as 0, and one will be recorded as 1. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n23s","text":"Plot these Norm-to-max values in Prism using the XY format with replicate values in side-by-side columns where NEMO values populate group 1 and p62 values populate group 2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kdmr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"blmv2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a3qon","text":"NEMO data can be further divided by whether puncta are NEMO-only or NEMO-p62.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
